abstract.text: Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The iOS 13 SDK provides support for developing apps for iPhone devices running iOS 13. The SDK comes bundled with Xcode 11 available from the Mac App Store. For information about Xcode 11, see

If your watch is running watchOS 6 beta, you must update it to watchOS 6 beta 2 or later before updating to iOS 13 beta 7 or later, otherwise your watch will no longer be able to connect to your phone. (52854192)
Snapshots for apps that use Metal might have an unexpected appearance in the App Switcher. (53121694)
key is no longer supported in iOS 13. Update your apps to handle modern multitasking. (43958234)
Voice Processing mode can now be enabled on
types can be used to wrap a user-defined block for sending or receiving data in real time.
A new method is available for an
-based app to retrieve a list of all nodes attached to an
selects the best spatial audio rendering algorithm automatically based on the output device.
property allows system sounds and haptics to play while the session actively uses audio input.
, informs apps which style of voice prompt they should play based on other audio activity in the system.
now permits apps to specify route-sharing policies so their audio and video routes to the same location as AirPlay.
Audio Unit Extensions now support user presets that are available across all host applications.
The OpenAL framework is deprecated and remains present for compatibility purposes. Transition to
Inter-App audio is deprecated. Use Audio Units for this functionality moving forward.
Carbon component-based Audio Units are deprecated and support will be removed in a future release.
Legacy Core Audio HAL audio hardware plug-ins are no longer supported.  Use audio server plug-ins for audio drivers moving forward.
Audio sharing is compatible with AirPods (1st generation or later) and PowerBeats Pro. iPhone 8 or later is required. (51331268)

now supports encoding video with alpha channels using HEVC.  Videos encoded in this manner are broadly supported in AVFoundation APIs, and by Safari within web pages. Technical details of the format can be found in the Interoperability Profile specification. (8045917)
By default, haptics are disabled when microphone recording begins. You can override this by setting the
— can’t be resumed during the event; no output occurs for that event, only for subsequent events. This applies to playback at a specific time offset, seeking, and resuming.(29274583)
instances with nonzero relative times that are sent as part of a
are incorrectly applied at the beginning of the
, instead of the expected nonzero relative time. This doesn’t occur on a
and vibration patterns generated through the user-created tap-to-vibrate UI are attenuated when compared to prior versions of iOS. (47448156)
Parameter Curves are not supported with a
. No error is generated when a
containing a Parameter Curve is passed to a

Brief audio distortion occurs when starting a Playback category app such as Music in the background. For example, brief distortion occurs if you start the app from Control Center while Core Haptics audio playback using a
Following any decompression to uncompressed floating-point samples, the total limit on all
resources per process is eight megabytes. (48659023)
Multiple overlapping Parameter Curves for the same
haptic event is 30 seconds. Events exceeding this limit can be constructed and accepted by
, but haptic playback will fade out after 30 seconds. (51322525)
initializers no longer support RAW version 5 and earlier. Version 6 and later remain supported. (50911303)
Added new APIs for instantiating and modifying the built-in Core Image filters.
filter is enhanced to support models with an input or output of type
instances support arguments with arbitrarily structured data.
instances support returning a group of 2 × 2 pixels.

, have changed to a new set of values that are consistent across platforms. The former values remain supported for backward compatibility; however, you should avoid dependancies on specific numerical values.
When performing an action in Find My that generates an email, you might see references to the Find My Friends and Find My iPhone apps. (51123613)

Health and Activity features will stop working if you set your Period Length to be longer than your Cycle Length in Cycle Tracking options. Ensure your Period Length is set to a shorter duration than your Cycle Length. (54313089)

After updating to iOS 13 beta 6 or later, iCloud Drive might synchronize for an extended period of time. If you notice any missing files, they can be found in a Recovered Files folder under On My iPhone within the Files app. (53772753)
When creating a new Pages, Numbers, or Keynote document in a shared folder, you might see the message: “Couldn’t connect to iCloud.” (50827963)
Ignore Blocked Senders can now be enabled in Settings > Mail. The blocked contacts list is shared with Messages, FaceTime, and Phone. (50775961)
Playback stops if an app using MediaPlayerFramework to play catalog content is backgrounded. (54131440)
The sparse texture API cannot be used from Swift in iOS 13. The issue is resolved in iOS 13.1 beta. (54146130)
In iOS 13, if you refer to a sparse texture in an argument buffer you must explicitly call
on the texture rather than calling

The state of the Sync Library switch in Settings > Music might inaccurately reflect the current state of the feature on your device. If you don’t want the feature enabled, ensure the switch is off. If your music library doesn’t appear to be in sync with other devices, try toggling the switch off then on again. (53957863)
no longer sniffs the MIME type when the server sends
Starting with iOS 13 beta 4, the copy attribute of the
is enforced. If the body data is mutated after the property setter has been called, data sent in the HTTP request won’t include that mutation. Invoking the property getter no longer returns a
reference, even when the setter was invoked with data of that type. As of iOS 13 beta 5, apps built using the iOS 12 SDK or previous SDKs use the legacy behavior. (53427882)
API has changed to address privacy. Please refer to the updated API documentation and headers for more details. (52707167)
HTTP method that contain a body now produce the error
delegate callback might not function as expected. (54309264)

Removed support for FTP and File URL schemes for Proxy Automatic Configuration (PAC). HTTP and HTTPS are the only supported URL schemes for PAC. This affects all PAC configurations including, but not limited to, configurations set using Settings, System Preferences, Profiles, and
APIs no longer support SPDY. Servers should use HTTP 2 or HTTP 1.1. (43391641)
Using search in Notes might produce unexpected results. (48238242)
If you select colored drawing strokes with the lasso tool and then rotate your device to landscape mode, the strokes will revert to black. (54246012)
If your app links PencilKit, please refrain from attempting to submit it to the App Store until further notice. (53811027)
Reality Files with object anchors don’t anchor to those objects in AR Quick Look or in applications. (53689364)
The camera feed will remain visible at the base of objects loaded from a Reality File when
: Turn off grounding shadows when setting the background to

If you enable Share Across Devices, Screen Time settings don’t sync with iCloud until your iOS device is restarted. Any edits you make to your Screen Time settings on that device before restarting are lost. (50194586)
the first time it’s accessed. After a few seconds, accessing it again returns the correct value. (47822242)

Shortcuts opened on iOS 13 are automatically upgraded and can no longer be opened on iOS 12. If a device with iOS 12 and a device with iOS 13 share an iCloud account, shortcuts might become unusable on the device running iOS 12. (50873839)
Disable iCloud Sync between devices running iOS 13 and devices running iOS 12.

Updated the APIs for creating animations. The basic animations are now named after the curve type — such as linear and easeInOut. The interpolation-based
, depending on whether or not the animation is driven interactively. (50280375)
Added an initializer for creating a
. By default, navigation views on iPhone and Apple TV visually reflect a navigation stack, while on iPad and Mac, a split-view styled navigation view displays. (51636729)

Apps containing SwiftUI inside a Swift package might not run on versions of iOS earlier than iOS 13. (53706729)
: When back-deploying to an OS which doesn’t contain the SwiftUI framework, add the
flag to the Other Linker Flags setting in the Build Settings tab. See
for more information on weak linking a framework. This workaround doesn’t apply when using dynamically linked Swift packages which import SwiftUI.
SwiftUI APIs deprecated in previous betas are now removed. (52587863, 53310683)

However, you shouldn’t pass a range that changes at runtime. If you use a variable that changes at runtime to define the range, the list displays views according to the initial range and ignores any subsequent updates to the range.

If you implement self-sizing cells in a
without using Auto Layout, the height you return is interpreted as the desired height for the
automatically adds any additional height needed to allow room for the cell separator. If you implement manual self-sizing this way, the cell’s
width is guaranteed to be accurate for you to use in manual layout calculations when
Trait environments, such as views and view controllers, now have their

property populated with traits during initialization. These initial traits represent a prediction of the ultimate traits that the trait environment will receive when it gets added to the hierarchy. Because the traits that are populated during initialization are just a prediction, they might differ from the traits that are received once actually in the hierarchy. Therefore, when possible you should wait to perform work that uses the
until the view, or view controller’s view, has moved into the hierarchy — meaning
value — so that you don’t have to throw away any work done using the predicted traits if the actual traits are different. The best time to use the
is during layout, such as inside

method is only called when the value of a trait changes. Importantly, because the trait collection is now initialized to a prediction of the ultimate traits in the destination hierarchy, when the initial predicted traits match the ultimate traits in the hierarchy,
will not be called when the trait environment is added to the hierarchy.  Because
is intended to be an invalidation callback to notify you that one or more traits changed, audit your existing implementations of this method, as well as the
, for places where you might have been relying on it to trigger initial setup. The best place to lazily perform work that uses the
methods discussed above, but remember that these layout methods are called any time layout occurs so be sure to avoid repeating work when you don’t need to. (46818941)
You can now enable debug logging to easily see when
is called on your own classes. Turn on the logging by using the following launch argument:
. You might want to temporarily disable the Main Thread Checker while using this launch argument and running your app from Xcode to avoid extra log messages for unrelated classes. (47858564)

property is always laid out edge-to-edge with adjacent accessories, both on the leading and the trailing side. This streamlines the layout code so developers who want the correct default offset no longer have to align their content with the content view border or the layout margin depending on whether there is an accessory on the trailing side or not. You should now always lay out their code on the layout margins of the cell’s content view to get the default system insets. These insets will be adjusted automatically based on the accessories visible in the cell to match the system’s default spacing. (48214114)
You can now invoke a custom initializer from a creation block that’s passed through

. This makes it possible for you to initialize view controllers with additional context and arguments, while taking advantage of defining them in a storyboard through Interface Builder. A custom controller initializer must call its
method and pass the coder argument that it receives through the creation block. (48313869)
Complications might disappear from Apple Watch after updating to iOS 13 if your watch isn’t running watchOS 6. (50507942)
Donated shortcuts might not appear in Search while using the simulator. (50832782)
Test on a device with Settings > Developer > Display Recent Shortcuts enabled.
Changing the volume level in Simulator while a video is playing in Safari mutes the audio. (51207286)

abstract.text: An object that manages a graph of audio nodes, controls playback, and configures real-time rendering constraints.
An object that simulates a 3D audio environment.
An object you use for audio generation, processing, or an I/O block.
An object that communicates to the system how you intend to use audio in your app.
The category for recording (input) and playback (output) of audio, such as for a Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) app.
Constants that indicate the prompt style to use.
Cases that indicate the possible route-sharing policies for an audio session.
A Boolean value that indicates whether system sounds and haptics play while recording from audio input.
Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity (alpha value).
An opaque type representing an audio processing graph.
Plays a system sound object.
A Boolean value indicating whether the app terminates, rather than moves to the background, when the app quits.
Downloads a proxy autoconfiguration script and executes it.
A type of object with a publisher that emits before the object has changed.
A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
The base class that all Core Data model objects inherit from.
A protocol that defines an advanced pattern player capable of looping, seeking, pausing, and resuming haptic playback.
A value that you send to a haptic pattern player to alter a property value during playback.
The identifier that reveals the type of property associated with a dynamic parameter.
An audio event with a looped waveform of arbitrary length.
An audio event using a waveform that you supply.
A haptic event with a looped waveform of arbitrary length.
An object representing a haptic waveform.
A protocol that defines a standard pattern player capable of playing haptic patterns with fixed parameters.
Sends an array of haptic parameters, starting at the specified time.
The type for multidimensional array features and feature values.
A font object.
Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to the resources you allocate from a heap.
Ensures the shaders in the render pass’s subsequent draw commands have access to a resource.
A Core Animation layer that Metal can render into, typically displayed onscreen.
Content that appears as the background of the scene.
The available rendering options that you use to selectively disable certain rendering effects.
Disable rendering of ambient occlusion and shadows that ground objects in an AR scene.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the speech recognizer can operate without network access.
A type that provides a collection of all of its values.
A sequence whose elements can be traversed multiple times, nondestructively, and accessed by an indexed subscript.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A signed integer value type.
A collection that supports subscript assignment.
Moves all the elements at the specified offsets to the specified destination offset, preserving ordering.
A type that represents either a wrapped value or the absence of a value.
A collection that supports replacement of an arbitrary subrange of elements with the elements of another collection.
Removes all the elements at the specified offsets from the collection.
An unordered collection of unique elements.
A convenience for a `spring` animation with a lower `response` value, intended for driving interactive animations.

An interpolating spring animation that uses a damped spring model to produce values in the range [0, 1] that are then used to interpolate within the [from, to] range of the animated property. Preserves velocity across overlapping animations by adding the effects of each animation.

A persistent spring animation. When mixed with other `spring()` or `interactiveSpring()` animations on the same property, each animation will be replaced by their successor, preserving velocity from one animation to the next. Optionally blends the response values between springs over a time period.
A property wrapper type that can read and write a value owned by a source of truth.
A representation of a color that adapts to a given context.
The sizes that you can specify for content.
A navigation view style represented by a primary view stack that navigates to a detail view.
A collection of environment values propagated through a view hierarchy.
Whether the system preference for Differentiate without Color is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Invert Colors is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Reduce Motion is enabled.
Whether the system preference for Reduce Transparency is enabled.
A binding to the current presentation mode of the view associated with this environment.
A property wrapper type that retrieves entities from a Core Data persistent store.
An environment-dependent font.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of identified data.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates map content across updates based on the provided key path to the underlying data’s identifier.
An alignment position along the horizontal axis.
A view that displays an image.
Sets the mode by which SwiftUI resizes an image to fit its space.
Creates a list that identifies its rows based on a key path to the identifier of the underlying data.
A view that controls a navigation presentation.
A view for presenting a stack of views that represents a visible path in a navigation hierarchy.
A property wrapper type that subscribes to an observable object and invalidates a view whenever the observable object changes.
A control for selecting from a set of mutually exclusive values.
A navigation view style represented by a view stack that only shows a single top view at a time.
A view that switches between multiple child views using interactive user interface elements.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
Sets the color of the text displayed by this view.
An alignment position for text along the horizontal axis.
An alignment position along the vertical axis.
Presents an action sheet when a given condition is true.
Presents an alert to the user.
Layers the given view behind this view.
Adds a border to this view with the specified style and width.
Sets the color of the foreground elements displayed by this view.
Positions this view within an invisible frame having the specified size constraints.
Adds an action to perform when this view recognizes a long press gesture.
Adds an action to perform when this view recognizes a tap gesture.
Layers a secondary view in front of this view.
Presents a sheet when a binding to a Boolean value that you provide is true.
A picker style that presents the options in a scrollable wheel that shows the selected option and a few neighboring options.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity.
A color object with grayscale and alpha values that are both `0.0`.
A set of methods for adapting the contents of your view controllers to size and trait changes.
Notifies the container that its trait collection changed.
A container view controller that defines a stack-based scheme for navigating hierarchical content.
The search controller to integrate into your navigation interface.
A standard control that can initiate the refreshing of a scroll view’s contents.
Do not adjust the scroll view insets.
The insets derived from the content insets and the safe area of the scroll view.
The custom distance that the content view is inset from the safe area or scroll view edges.
The behavior for determining the adjusted content offsets.
A view controller that manages the display of search results based on interactions with a search bar.
Creates the initial view controller from the storyboard and initializes it using your custom initialization code.
Creates the specified view controller from the storyboard and initializes it using your custom initialization code.
A view that presents data using rows in a single column.
The visual representation of a single row in a table view.
The content view of the cell object.
Sets the highlighted state of the cell, optionally animating the transition between states.
Sets the selected state of the cell, optionally animating the transition between states.
Reports changes in the iOS interface environment.
The view’s background color.
A Boolean value that determines whether the view is opaque.
Lays out subviews.
Asks the view to calculate and return the size that best fits the specified size.
The receiver’s window object, or `nil` if it has none.
A Boolean value that indicates whether this view controller’s view is covered when the view controller or one of its descendants presents a view controller.
The navigation item used to represent the view controller in a parent’s navigation bar.
Notifies the view controller when its view finishes laying out its subviews.
Notifies the view controller that its view is about to lay out its subviews.
Update your apps to use new features, and test your apps against API changes.
The basic type for floating-point scalar values in Core Graphics and related frameworks.
The properties you use to configure a Core ML model filter.
Creates a filter that allows the processing of RAW images.
Creates a filter that allows the processing of RAW images.
Pixel data formats for image input, output, and processing.
A 32-bit-per-pixel, fixed-point pixel format in which the alpha value precedes the red, green, and blue color components.
A GPU-based image-processing routine used to create custom Core Image filters.
A collection of unique integer values that represent the indexes of elements in another collection.
A dynamic byte buffer that bridges to ; use  when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A mutable URL load request that bridges to  and you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
The request body as an input stream.
An object that enables you to start and stop URL requests.
The length of the resource data exceeded the maximum allowed.
Ignore local cache data, and instruct proxies and other intermediates to disregard their caches so far as the protocol allows.
Use cache data if the origin source can validate it; otherwise, load from the origin.
An object that coordinates a group of related, network data transfer tasks.
A dictionary containing information about the proxy to use within this session.
A task, like downloading a specific resource, performed in a URL session.
Tells the delegate that the task is waiting until suitable connectivity is available before beginning the network load.
Returns the current network information for a given network interface.

An object representing a dynamic byte buffer in memory.
